model_solution:
## Step 1: Write the formula for combinations
$\dbinom{n}{k} = \dfrac{n!}{k!(n-k)!}$
## Step 2: Plug in values for n and k into the formula
$\dbinom{30}{27} = \dfrac{30!}{27!(30-27)!}$
## Step 3: Simplify the factorial expressions in the formula
$\dbinom{30}{27} = \dfrac{30 \times 29 \times 28 \times 27!}{27! \times 3!}$
## Step 4: Cancel out the common terms in the numerator and the denominator
$\dbinom{30}{27} = \dfrac{30 \times 29 \times 28}{3!}$
## Step 5: Calculate 3! and divide it into the numerator expression
$\dbinom{30}{27} = \dfrac{30 \times 29 \times 28}{6}$
## Step 6: Simplify the fraction
$\dbinom{30}{27} = \dfrac{24,360}{6} = 4,060$
## Step 7: Simplify the fraction
$\dbinom{30}{27} = 4,060$
## Step 8: Simplify the fraction
$\dbinom{30}{27} = 4,060$
$\dbinom{30}{27} = \dfrac{30 \times 29 \times 28}{6}$
## Step 9: Simplify the fraction
$\dbinom{30}{27} = \dfrac{24,360}{6}$
steps:
## Step 1: Write the formula for combinations
$\dbinom{n}{k} = \dfrac{n!}{k!(n-k)!}$

## Step 2: Plug in values for n and k into the formula
$\dbinom{30}{27} = \dfrac{30!}{27!(30-27)!}$

## Step 3: Simplify the factorial expressions in the formula
$\dbinom{30}{27} = \dfrac{30 \times 29 \times 28 \times 27!}{27! \times 3!}$

## Step 4: Cancel out the common terms in the numerator and the denominator
$\dbinom{30}{27} = \dfrac{30 \times 29 \times 28}{3!}$

## Step 5: Calculate 3! and divide it into the numerator expression
$\dbinom{30}{27} = \dfrac{30 \times 29 \times 28}{6}$
full_steps:
## Step 1: Write the formula for combinations
$\dbinom{n}{k} = \dfrac{n!}{k!(n-k)!}$

## Step 2: Plug in values for n and k into the formula
$\dbinom{30}{27} = \dfrac{30!}{27!(30-27)!}$

## Step 3: Simplify the factorial expressions in the formula
$\dbinom{30}{27} = \dfrac{30 \times 29 \times 28 \times 27!}{27! \times 3!}$

## Step 4: Cancel out the common terms in the numerator and the denominator
$\dbinom{30}{27} = \dfrac{30 \times 29 \times 28}{3!}$

## Step 5: Calculate 3! and divide it into the numerator expression
$\dbinom{30}{27} = \dfrac{30 \times 29 \times 28}{6}$
